result.markdown:
--- title: "100_html_CSS_examples.qmd" format: html: fontsize: 9px css: quarto_example_CSS.css editor: source editor_options: chunk_output_type: console --- PURPOSE: .qmd files, markdown, r code (knitr), CSS (via external CSS), embeded CSS in this page USAGE1: quarto preview renders and displays in browser USAGE2: quarto render ; To view xdg-open _quarto.xml controls output dir for *.html *** [An *aside* puts a note in right margin]{.aside} *** The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed). We can use CSS or SASS to style individual words, or link [phrases](https://google.com){style="font-size: 24px"} for spans (in-line), paragraphs divs (see `selector`) or or formatting elements (e.g. header 2) ------------------------------------------------------------------------ [pink link to nytimes.com](https://nytimes.com){style="color:pink"} using angle brackets: [red text]{style="color:red"} [background yellow]{style="background-color: yellow"} [both red & background yellow]{style="color: red; background-color:yellow"} *** ::: {style="font-size: 8px; color:green"} This paragrpah should be in very small font. ;aldkjf dsaf;ldsa fsa fdsa. lkajf sal;df as. adfljdf . adsflkjaf sa. a;lkdfj ad;f . ::: *** This uses class from .css file, .blueish

<.blueish>what color am I?

*** This is "greenish" from external .css file *** ::: This paragrpah should be in very small font. ;aldkjf dsaf;ldsa fsa fdsa. lkajf sal;df as. adfljdf . adsflkjaf sa. a;lkdfj ad;f ::: *** inline R: 2023-07-09 *** # R chunk ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "second" ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "2023-07-09" ``` ::: ::: *** ::: {.foo style="color: forestgreen; font-size: 32px"} yukb goo ::: *** Here are some plain words that are not subject to any styling CSS or SCSS *** my [special-words]{style="color: goldenrod; font-size: 24px"} *** ## small header size two {style="color: red; font-size: 7px"} ## regular header size two what else [can we do without]{style="color: darkorange; font-size: 12px"}going crazy *** Also, be sure to render the document into an HTML so that you get the full effect.hope it helps. (edited)
